pr_title: [IOTDB-810] Set Configuration of Max Number of Logs in Memory

timeline.message: add max num of logs in mem config
rename minimum number of logs in memory
log number out of bound exception

timeline.bodyText: Maybe this should be 1000 or at least a different number from min.
timeline.author: jt2594838

replies.bodyText: Sorry for the mistake. I will correct it.
replies.author: Ring-k

timeline.bodyText:
Add more specific comments like
"# minimum number of committed logs in memory, after each log deletion, at most such number of logs will remain in memory. Increasing the number will reduce the chance to use snapshot in catch-ups, but will also increase memory footprint"
"# maximum number of committed logs in memory, when reached, a log deletion will be triggered. Increasing the number will reduce the chance to use snapshot in catch-ups, but will also increase memory footprint"
timeline.author: jt2594838
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -66,8 +66,11 @@ max_unsnapshoted_log_size=134217728
 # whether to use batch append entries in log catch up
 use_batch_in_catch_up=true
 
-# max number of committed logs to be saved
-max_number_of_logs=100
+# minimum number of committed logs in memory
+min_num_of_logs_in_mem=100
+
+# maximum number of committed logs in memory
+max_num_of_logs_in_mem=1000

replies.bodyText: Sure, that will be more clear.
replies.author: Ring-k

timeline.bodyText: You should trigger a log deletion and proceed the committing instead of throwing an exception.
timeline.author: jt2594838

replies.bodyText: I see. Thanks for your suggestion.
replies.author: Ring-k

timeline.bodyText: This exception is unneeded, and we should solve it silently by triggering a log deletion.
timeline.author: jt2594838
